captions.text:
Welcome to the House of Tuerck! On this episode 
 you're going to spend a  day

with me and my friends. Just doing some Tuerck stuff so 
 first we're going to head to my Mom's restaurant

to get some breakfast and I got some yard work to 
 do. We're gonna head over to my friend's farm
after that, get some milk and fresh doughnuts. Finish it up with a bonfire.
But first, let's eat!
Ahhh.. This thing is ....
Woahhh!!! Wow! It's some yard work and let's start to have some fun,
Alright, looks pretty good. Let's give this thing a test and hit the farm.
Alright, it feels pretty good to me. Let's get some milk
Yo, everybody watch out coz I don't know where this is gonna go.
It's got a charge on it to fly. So, sh*t, yeah! Whip that ***!
There you go ... Uh, f**k! Hahaha! Hahahah! Like I said.
Exactly what I said, what the f**k! Hahaah!

We're gonna slay the f**k out if this ... 
 Hahahaha! This is my idea of fun.
I guess,
Dude, I wasn't expecting to blow up that good. Hahahaha!
How much gas should I put in here? All of it, hahaha!
We've got another do over, hahaha!
Hahahaha! That was f**king awesome! Hahaha!
Hahahah!
That was perfect! Whoooo!!!
That's the House of Tuerck! Ohhh!!! Hahahaah!

Thank you for watching this episode of Tuerck, 
 share the video if you liked it.

Leave some comments below and make sure to subscribe to 
 Network A for the rest of the Tuerck series.

title: Real Drift Life: The House Of Tuerck! Tuerck'd: Ep. 5

comments.author: Profeten CSGO

comments.text:
The car's electrical systems. From left to right: Start, Ignition, Fuel 
Pump, Water Pump, Lamps, and Accy (accessory). Because shitbox drift 
missiles (and racecars in general) tend to catch fire somewhat more often 
than regular cars, the electrical system uses circuit breakers like your 
house instead of fuses like your car. That way you can reset them on the 
fly if they trip, or kill power to them if they're about to, y'know, ignite.

I THINK that's a Painless Performance 6-switch dash rocker panel, but like 
everything else on that car it's been beaten on and bodged together.
